definition: penny wise and pound foolish (idiom)
to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
small/tiny/few/young
to lose/to miss/to fail
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]

sentences.english: You can't afford accumulated a variety of extra burden penny-wise and pound foolish.
sentences.chinese: 你付不起贪小失大所累积的种种额外负担。

definition: to save a little only to lose a lot (idiom)
to let go of the big prize while grabbing at trifles (idiom)
pinyin: jian3 le5 zhi1 ma5 diu1 le5 xi1 gua1

definition: to easily trust/gullible/naïve
to be taken advantage of
you must not/Please don't.../be sure not to/on no account (do it)
mad about money (idiom)
to covet/to seek (riches, fame)
a single slip may cause everlasting sorrow (idiom)
pinyin: yi1 shi1 zu2 cheng2 qian1 gu3 hen4

definition: there is no such thing as a free lunch (idiom)
pinyin: tian1 shang4 bu4 hui4 diao4 xian4 bing3

definition: by no means
to neglect the root and pursue the tip (idiom)/to neglect fundamentals and concentrate on details
to buy a wooden box and return the pearls inside/to show poor judgment (idiom)
selective listening/to hear what one wants to hear
to falsely believe/to be mislead/to fall for (a trick etc)
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
to misappropriate
